laboratory_examinations.findings: Peripheral eosinophilia (976/mm3, 16%) with a normal white blood cell count (6.1).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially improved with treatment, but flared once oral steroids were tapered.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Viral and bacterial cultures from blister fluid

laboratory_examinations.findings: Microscopic examination revealed acanthosis, spongiosis, and interstitial and perivascular dermal eosinophilic infiltrates.
